posts.author: Vhalyr
posts.content:
Hello, i finally decided to play the Aielund saga. I have a question though: how to change equipment of the henchmen?

That said, i was aiming at making a two weapons weaponmaster. Is scimitar the best weapon?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I should be able to answer some of these questions
Equipment can be changed in two ways 
- through dialogue (talk to them, ask to change their inventory - there will be an option there)
- by right clicking their icon on the right hand side of the screen, there will be a menu, through which the inventory can be accessed and altered.

As to the best single handed weapon, I seem to recall there are quite a few good katanas, longswords and short swords, but some of the others might have some more input on that question.
Not sure about scimitars.

If it helps devastating critical is disabled in Aielund so the critical threat range of a weapon is important but not as important as usual

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Orion is quite right in all he says.

Before offering any weapon advice, I'm afraid I have a couple of questions. First, when you say "a two weapons weaponmaster", do you mean one with a focus (or even WoC) in two separate weapons (eg, one slashing, one blunt), to be used singly with a shield, or one who dual-wields one weapon type (eg, twin shortswords)?

The second question is about what else makes up your build. What other classes are you taking? What race will you be playing? Are you going for a strength or dexterity based build?

I'm not asking just to be nosey, I promise. For example, if you've got some Monk in there, d-w kamas might well be a good idea. If you're thinking of halfling, scimitar will be a 2-handed weapon. If you're going Dex-based, you'll be wanting a finessable weapon. If you d-w scimitars (or any non-small/tiny weapon) you'll take an extra -2 hit to AB. And so on...

That'll teach you to ask a simple question, eh? 😉

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Trying to make it simple:
Is this the kind of build you mean by a Two weapons Weaponmaster ?

posts.author: Vhalyr
posts.content:
Hello,

regarding how to equip companions, i kind of feel very stupid at the moment: i had no dialogue option, but there was the option in the radial menu that i TOTALLY didn't notice at all :/
As for the rest, yeah, for ''best weapon'' i was talking about damage/critical range, and as for ''two weapon'' i do mean, in facts, dual wielding. I was thinking about dual wielding the same weapon on both hands, to maximize attack rolls, and i was aiming at the scimitar for its crit range, but i obviously didn't know that devastating critical is disabled...

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Kukris have the same crit range as scimitars. You can dual wield them with minimum penalties, but will need the exotic weapon proficiency.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote: Trying to make it simple:
Is this the kind of build you mean by a Two weapons Weaponmaster ?
That's a build I really like, Mick - and I've played it several times. Just a note of caution for Valhyr, though - I don't recall many quality kukris in Aielund, so you might want to think of dual-wielding shortswords (there are many good ones). That would also give you an extra feat, as you wouldn't need Exotic Proficiency. With a little juggling of when you take the feats, IKD might be a good one.

EDIT: I seemed to recall that Empyre had made an Aielund-specific shortsword dual-wielder, and you can find it at the top of page 7 in the Aielund thread in the Modules forum (Aielund Draco Twinblade). It's a Fighter 20/ Bard 10/ RDD 10, so not a weaponmaster, but it still has a max AB of 47, which ain't exactly shabby.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Thank you Stag!
I want to add that I don't share that much your concern about weapon types for this weaponmaster in Aielund. In Act 1 you will find +1 Kukris. If you find other weapons you want to dual wield, he will be able to do that with little penalty.

In act 2 and onwards you will find, and even be able to buy most weapons with an adequate enhancement ,and you can add extra damage and other properties to any weapon.
I usually spend a substantial amount of gold to have weapons with different elemental damage types available. With a dual wielder that amounts to quite a few blades.

It is true that you will find more weapons of certain types, especially the kind that the henchmen use, but that should not stop you from trying something different.
